doc.field: Letter from William F. Cody to John R. Brennan, October 28, 1907

[Letterhead imprint: Buffalo Bill's Wild West]
Ferrill, Texas Oct 28th, 07
Major John R. Brennan. Agent Pine Ridge Agency So. Dak.
My Dear Major,
The Indians with me want a favor. And as they have been such good men I hope you will grant it.
They have been saving and bought a great many useful things to take home. But they are shy a bunch and it breaks an Indians heart to go home without a trunk.
They would like to have $10 each the $25 a month men. The Chiefs $15 each. This to be taken from their last month and back pay that is to be paid them in your presence.
Hope you will grant their request.
Very faithfully yours W. F. Cody
